    		Learning Technologies
    	EAPP's Learning Technologies area includes support and maintenance for enterprise learning technology systems, such as Canvas, Blackboard Learn, Kaltura Media, and Zoom virtual classrooms.
                        Canvas
                    New Learning Management SystemCourse materialsPublisher integrationsGradebookCanvas login...
                        Blackboard
                    Legacy Learning Management SystemCourse materialsPublisher integrationsGradebookBlackboard login...
                        Zoom
                    Video ConferencingRemote meetingsVirtual classroomScreen sharingZoom login...
                        Kaltura
                    Media HostingVideo and media filesAutomatic captioningLecture captureKaltura login...
                        Need Help?
                    Our physical offices are closed until further notice, but the majority of our services can be accessed online.By Email: bblearn@csuchico.eduEmails sent to this addresses will open support tickets.Canvas After Hours support: (530)-230-0546 or via the Canvas Help Menu.Blackboard After Hours support: 530-898-HELP after 5:00 PMITSS is forwarding after-hours calls to an offsite vendor; we will follow up once we're in the office.General information:Supported Services: Inventory of services in this area.Policies & Procedures: Documentation of guidelines and best practices.Learning Systems Diagram: Visual representation of our services and their overlap.Our work:LMS Advisory Group: Steering committee for discussion of operational and project work.Instance Management: Login links for production and non-production systems.Projects: Upcoming and historic changes to services.Change Management: Process goals and upcoming maintenance dates and logs.System status:Service Interruptions: Log of downtime and other user-facing impact to services.Analytics: Reports on system usage and team workload.Information TechnologyMeriam Library, Room 338www.csuchico.edu/itSupport Our CollegeMore in our divisionComputing & Communication ServicesCreative Media & TechnologyEnterprise ApplicationsInformation SecurityIT Administrative ServiceIT Support ServicesInstitutional Research
We acknowledge and are mindful that Chico State stands on lands that were originally occupied by the first people of this area, Mechoopda, and we recognize their distinctive spiritual relationship with this land, the flora, the fauna, and the waters that run through campus. We are humbled that our campus resides upon sacred lands that since time immemorial have sustained the Mechoopda people and continue to do so today.Contact UsNeed Help?FacebookFacebookTwitterTwitterInstagramInstagramReport an accessibility issueReport a broken link on this pageTitle IXPrivacy PolicyCalifornia State University, Chico400 West First StreetChico, CA 95929Copyright © 2023 All Rights Reserved
